definitions.definition: To chop or cut into small pieces.
definitions.example: The workers chipped the dead branches into mulch.
Be careful not to chip the paint.

definitions.definition: To play a shot hitting the ball predominantly upwards rather than forwards. In association football specifically, when the shot is a shot on goal, the opposing goalkeeper may be the direct object of the verb, rather than the ball.
To upgrade an engine management system, usually to increase power.
To fit (an animal) with a microchip.

definitions.example: Everyone needs to chip in £1 for George's leaving collection

definitions.definition: (also, to chip at) To make fun of.
Having one or more chips (small pieces) missing.
Having had the engine management system upgraded, usually to increase power.
